You count as one size larger when determining whom you can grapple or shove.
Your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift is one and a half times its normal value.

feat.name: Stone Headed
entries: Lack of mental capability has turned into something good for you, and you gain the following benefits:

items: Your Constitution score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You have advantage on saving throws made to resist enchantment spells.
You are immune to being charmed.

feat.name: Whip Master
entries: You've learned how to use the out-of-the-ordinary properties of a whip to your advantage. Its versatile nature allows you to perform a variety of maneuvers. While wielding a whip you also gain the following benefits:

items: With the whip, you can manipulate objects such as switches, levers, chests, or doorknobs within 10 feet. If an object weighs fewer than 5 pounds, you can grab and deposit it into a free hand.

entries: In addition, when you take the Attack action and attack with only a whip, you can use a bonus action to use one of the following effects:

items: You can attempt to disarm or knock prone a creature within range. Make an attack roll with a -5 penalty contested by the target's Stength (Athletics) check or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check (the target chooses the ability to use). You automatically fail the contest if the target is two or more size categories larger than you. If you win the contest, the attack causes no damage or other ill effect, but the defender either drops an item of your choice or is knocked prone (your choice).
You can make a single weapon attack with a whip against a creature within range.
You can use the Help action to aid an ally attacking an enemy within 10 feet of you.

feat.name: Advanced Psionics
entries: You've trained your mind to greatly improve your psionic capabilities. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell message|PHB} cantrip

You learn the catapult and enhance ability spells and can cast them once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast them again when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

feat.name: Aquan Magic
entries: You are more attuned to the magic of the Elemental Plane of Water than others of your kind. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Charisma modifier increases by 1.
You learn the {@spell shape water|xge} cantrip.

You learn the ice knife spell, and may cast it at second level once without expending a spell slot. You regain use of this ability after you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

feat.name: Arcane Plagiarist
entries: You have learned to mimic the magical abilities of others. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Wisdom score increases by 1.
You learn the {@spell minor illusion|PHB} cantrip.

You learn the silent image spell and may cast it once at first level without expending a spell slot. You regain use of this ability after you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

feat.name: Athletic Perfection
entries: The time spent competing with your peers has helped to shape your body to a near perfect state. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Strength or Dexterity score increases by 1.
You gain proficiency in Stealth, Acrobatics or Sleight of Hand.
You have advantage on Athletics checks made to throw objects or small creatures.

feat.name: Auran Spirit
entries: You have learned spent time learning from your elders, preparing to tend to the spiritual need of your tribe. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell guidance|PHB} and {@spell gust|xge} cantrips.

You learn the augury or the find familiar spell. You can cast the spell you choose as a ritual. (If you choose the find familiar spell, unless you gain it from another source, you can only conjure a creature with a flying speed).

feat.name: Blood of The Chameleon
entries: You are skilled at ambushing foes and prey, aided by modified scales. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Dexterity score increases by 1.
You gain proficiency in Stealth.
Your scales can change hue to aid your ambushes. You can attempt to hide while only lightly obscured by foliage, snow, heavy rain and other natural effects.

feat.name: Blood of The Komodo
entries: You produce acidic saliva, which you can use to augment your attacks. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Constitution score increases by 1.
You gain resistance to poison damage.

You secrete a dangerous venom. When you make a bite attack, you can choose to add an additional 1d6 acid damage. You can do this a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier, and you regain all uses after you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Child Of The Current
entries: You were born in the water, and have learned to use it to increase your vitality. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Strength or Constitution score increases by 1.
You have advantage on Athletics checks while underwater.
If you spend an entire short rest submerged in water, you may treat a number of hit dice up to your Constitution modifier as having rolled their maximum.

feat.name: Divine Avatar
entries: You have learned to harness the divine energy within you to aid your allies, as well as smite your enemies. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Constitution score increases by 1.

When you transform into your divine form using your Radiant Consumption, Radiant Soul or Necrotic Shroud feature, creatures of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you regain hit points equal to your level.

feat.name: Draconic Blessing
entries: Either you or your ancestors received a boon from a chromatic dragon, granting you a spark of their power. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Charisma score increases by 1.

entries: Choose one of the following draconic bloodlines. You gain the benefits associated with it:

items.name: Black.
entries: You gain resistance to acid damage and learn the {@spell acid splash|PHB} cantrip.

items.name: Blue.
entries: You gain resistance to lightning damage and learn the {@spell shocking grasp|PHB} cantrip.

items.name: Green.
entries: You gain resistance to poison damage and learn the {@spell poison spray|PHB} cantrip.

items.name: Red.
entries: You gain resistance to fire damage and learn the {@spell produce flame|PHB} cantrip.

items.name: White.
entries: You gain resistance to cold damage and learn the {@spell ray of frost|PHB} cantrip.

feat.name: Emissary of The Air
entries: The quickness of wind guides your movements. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Dexterity score increases by 1.

In response to being hit with a weapon attack, you can use your reaction to transform your body into wind, instantly reappearing in an unoccupied space within 60 feet causing the attack to miss. You regain use of this ability after you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Expert Mimic
entries: You have spent so long copying others, it's second nature to you now. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with two of the following: {@item thieves' tools|PHB}, {@item forgery kit|PHB} , {@item calligraphy' tools|PHB} or {@item painter' tools|PHB}

During a long rest, you can spend time observing a willing creature. From this, you can mimic their proficiency in a specific skill or tool, gaining proficiency in this skill until the start of your next long rest.

feat.name: Fey Spirit
entries: You are more in touch with the fickle magics of the Feywild than others of you kind, allowing you to alter your form. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Charisma score increases by 1.
You can speak, read, and write Sylvan.

You learn the {@spell alter self|PHB} spell and can cast it once without expending a spell slot. You regain use of this feature once you complete a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

feat.name: Focused Radiance
entries: You have learned to focus the divine energy within your body, using it to cast spells. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Wisdom or Charisma score increases by 1.
You learn the  {@spell guidance|PHB} or  {@spell sacred flame|PHB} cantrip.

You learn the  {@spell bless|PHB} or  {@spell guiding bolt|PHB} spell, and may cast it once at second level without using a spell slot. You regain use of this ability when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

feat.name: Grasp of The Earth
entries: You use the power of the earth to impede your enemies. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Strength score increases by 1.

As an action, you can strike the ground, causing soil and rocks to leap up around another creature within 30 feet. This creature must make a Strength saving through (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier) or be take 1d6 bludgeoning damage and be restrained for 1 minute. If this creature is within range, you may use a bonus action to make a melee weapon attack against it. You regain use of this ability after you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Guardian of The Waves
entries: You are attuned to the oceans and the deep places of the world, gracing you with powers. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Wisdom score increases by 1.

As an action, you give yourself a watery form that lasts for one round. While in this form, you can pass through another creature's space, however you cannot end your turn there. While in this form, you may also pass through gaps as small as 1 inch. You regain the use of this ability after you finish a short or long rest.
You can cast the speak with animals spell at will, however unless you gain it from another source you can only speak with creatures that can breathe water, as well as dolphins and whales.

feat.name: Iron Will
entries: The Chaos of Limbo is truly violent, and you have trained your mind to resist it. You gain the following benefit:

items: You have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma saving throws against spells.

feat.name: Lazy Brute
entries: The sooner you get done dealing with your foes, the sooner you can go back to sleep. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you roll a critical hit on a melee weapon attack, you can roll one additional damage dice.
If you spend all of a short rest sleeping, you gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus + half your level (rounded down).

feat.name: Leader of The Pack
entries: You have a magnetic personality, and cats always seem to look to you for guidance. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Charisma score increases by 1.
You have advantage on Animal Handling checks made with feline creatures.
Once per long rest you may cast the  {@spell find familiar|PHB} spell as a ritual. Unless you gain this spell from another source, when you cast it this way you can only target a cat.

feat.name: Light on Your Feet
entries: No matter how you fall, you always seem to be able to twist and land on your feet. You gin the following benefits:

items: Your Dexterity score increases by 1.
You gain proficiency in Acrobatics.
You do not take damage from falling 20 feet or less. When you do take damage from falling, you may reduce the damage by an amount equal to half your level.

feat.name: Magic of The Grove
entries: There are few as attuned to the forest as you. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Wisdom score increases by 1.
You learn the  {@spell druidcraft|PHB} cantrip
You learn the {@spell pass without trace|PHB} spell, and may cast it once without expending a spell slot. You regain use of this ability after you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Make-do Attitude
entries: You've learned to survive and craft basic tools and weapons from only what you can scavenge. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Wisdom score increases by 1.
You gain proficiency with one of the following:  {@item woodcarver's tools|PHB}, {@item weaver's tools|PHB}, {@item herbalism kit|PHB}

During a short or long rest, provided you have access to an appropriate crafting material (ie. wood, vines, etc) you can make one of the following: a fishing pole, a club, a net, a blow gun or 10 blowgun darts. To do this you require appropriate tools (ie. Woodcarvers) or a dagger.

feat.name: Mountain's Blessing
entries: The markings that cover your body expand, indicating your blessing by a mountain spirit. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Intelligence or Wisdom score increases by one.
You gain proficiency in Religion

When you make a saving throw against a magical effect, you may choose to give yourself advantage on the roll. You can do this after you see the roll, but before you know the result. You regain use of this feature after you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Nest of Serpents
entries: You've studied the rituals of those in higher castes as they devote themselves to the serpent gods, and you've picked up a thing or two from them. You gain the following benefit:

items: As an action, you can transform a pile of sticks, ten arrows or small pieces of wood into a swarm of poisonous snakes. The swarm acts as your ally, and obeys your commands. This transformation lasts for one minute, after which the swarm reverts to its original form. If the swarm is killed before this, it reverts to normal early. You may do this once, and regain this ability after you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Primordial Constitution
entries: As a plane touched humanoid, your body is hardier than many others. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Constitution score increases by one.
You gain resistance to cold and poison damage.
You have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned.

feat.name: Promising Commander
entries: You performed endless training routines to amplify your tactical abilities in the timeless Astral Sea. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Strength score increases by one.
You learn one language of your choice.

As a bonus action, you let out a rallying war cry, ending the frightened or charmed condition on yourself and a number of allies that can hear you equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). You can use this ability once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Protector Of Nature
entries: You have learned to use Fey charms to prevent others from tampering with the areas you protect. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in Persuasion. If you are already proficient, you can add double your proficiency bonus to your persuasion checks.

As an action, you can beguile those who would damage the natural world. Choose one creature within 30 feet of you. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 + proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier) or become charmed by you for 1 minute. A creature makes this saving throw with disadvantage if it has harmed a beast or plant in the past round. If the target takes any damage, it may repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. You can do this once, and regain the ability to do it again after you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Savage Attacker
entries: When you hit someone, they had better stay down. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Strength score increases by one.

When you reduce a creature to zero hitpoints with a melee weapon attack, you can make another melee weapon attack as a bonus action. If this attack hits, it does additional damage equal to your Strength modifier.

feat.name: Shadow Magic
entries: In the lifetimes you have spent serving your shrouded queen, you have gained an affinity for magic that influences others. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn the friends cantrip.

You learn the {@spell charm person|PHB} and {@spell detect thoughts|PHB} spells and can cast each spell once without expending a spell slot. You regain the use of this feature once you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

feat.name: Serpent Form
entries: You have unlocked more of your serpentfolk heritage. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Intelligence or Charisma score increases by 1.

You can use an action to polymorph into a Medium snake or back into your true form. Your statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment you are wearing or carrying isn't transformed. If you die, you stay in your current form.

While in snake form, you gain a bite attack as a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. When you hit with a bite attack, you can choose to deal 2d6 additional poison damage to the target. Once you deal this poison damage, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Strength of The Sea
entries: Your time deep beneath the waves has toughened your body. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Constitution score increases by one.
You gain resistance to cold and acid damage
You are resistant to the effects of extreme pressure.

feat.name: The Eternal Flame
entries: A flame burns within you, and you've learned how to harness it. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Intelligence score increases by one.

As an action, you surround yourself with a wreath of flames which lasts for one minute. While this is active, any creature that hits you with a melee attack from within 5 feet of you takes fire damage equal to your Constitution modifier.
Additionally, when you roll fire damage while this wreath is active, you may add your Constitution modifier to the damage rolled. You regain use of this ability after you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Trickster's Spirit
entries: You are accustomed to using others to avoid being attacked. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Dexterity score increases by 1.

When a creature you can see targets you with an attack and another creature is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Wings of Iron
entries: You have spent your formative years training with the wardens of your tribe. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Dexterity score increases by one.
You gain proficiency with spears, javelins and nets.
When you are flying and dive at least 30 feet towards a target and hit it with a melee weapon, you can cause the attack to deal an additional 1d6 damage of the weapons type to the target.

subclassFeature.name: Botanist
entries: Nature always strives for survival, flourishing in the harshest of environments and adapting to the changes made with each era. Botanists are artificers who have taken a liking to the great green and have made it their goal to study and improve its resilient attributes with their technology. They ensure that their innovations can take upon existing floral life and break through their deep-rooted capabilities. Through this mutual benefit, they entrust nature to defend them and in doing so, will provide what is necessary for them to grow and survive.

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item potter's tools|PHB}. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of {@item artisan's tools|PHB} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Botanist Spells
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Botanist Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Green Thumb
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you can quickly familiarize yourself with many species of flora and learn their unique properties. You gain proficiency in the Nature skill, and you can use your Intelligence modifier instead of Wisdom modifier whenever you make an ability check to interact or identify them. You can also study plant life for a certain amount of time to gain the following benefits:

items: If you study the plant for at least 1 minute, you double your proficiency bonus on Nature checks towards the plant as well as advantage on the roll.
If you study the plant for at least 10 minutes, you learn the complete properties of the plant as well as its potential uses.
Your ability to analyze plant life extends even to the smallest of samples, such as a seed, leaf, fruit, or even a piece of bark, provided they occur naturally.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Growth
entries: Also at 3rd level, you have prepared a couple of seeds within your pots that can grow at incredible speed when unleashed. While you have your potter's tools with you, you can use an action to throw a pot in an unoccupied space within 30 feet that you can see. The pot breaks upon impact, creating an Awakened Shrub that lasts for 1 hour or until it is reduced to 0 hit points, or you use a bonus action to dismiss it, causing it to root itself and become a normal shrub.

In combat, the Awakened Shrub shares your initiative count, but takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the Dodge action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you are incapacitated, the defender can take any action of its choice, not just Dodge.
When you have more than one Awakened Shrub summoned this way, you can use your bonus action to command all of them at once, giving the same order or different order for each one.
The Awakened Shrub is friendly towards you and your companions and has the following modifications:

items: It has a number of hit point equal to 10 + your Intelligence modifier + twice your level in this class.
Its AC equals 10 + your Intelligence modifier.
You add your proficiency bonus to its ability scores.
You add your Intelligence modifier to its attack and damage rolls.
Attacks made by your Awakened Shrub deal an additional 1d4 poison damage.

entries: You can use this feature twice and regain all expended uses when finish a short or long rest. You gain an additional use of this feature when you reach 6th level (3 uses) and 15th level (4 uses).

subclassFeature.name: Deadly Bloom
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you have a pocket full of seeds that you use in conjunction with your attacks, ready to germinate in order to deliver a poisonous payload. Whenever you roll for damage for an artificer cantrip or spell, the target takes poison damage equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) at the start of their next turn. This damage can accumulate if you dealt more than one instance of damage to a creature before their turn.

Additionally, when your plant summoned by Wild Growth is dismissed or reduced to 0 hit points, it releases pollen in a 10-foot cube centered on itself, forcing all hostile creatures to succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A creature poisoned this way must make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns or take 1d4 poison damage. On a successful save, the effect ends.
Furthermore, all attacks made by plants summoned by Wild Growth now count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

subclassFeature.name: Verdant Power
entries: Starting at 9th level, you are capable of growing the giants of flora, calling upon the heavy reinforcements of nature. You can now use your Wild Growth to create an Awakened Tree in the space you choose, growing rapidly at the start of your next turn. Your Awakened Tree acts the same as an Awakened Shrub in combat and has the following modifications:

items: It has a number of hit points equal to 40 + your Intelligence modifier + twice your level in this class.
You add your Intelligence modifier to its AC, as well as its attack and damage rolls.

When it is reduced to 0 hit points, the awakened tree collapses in a 15-foot cube in a direction of your choice. All creatures within the radius must make a Dexterity saving throw or take 6d6 bludgeoning damage or half as much on a successful save.

entries: You can only have one Awakened Tree at a time and it lasts for 1 hour or until it is reduced to 0 hit points, or you use a bonus action to dismiss it, causing it to root itself and become a normal tree.

subclassFeature.name: Awakened Forest
entries: At 15th level, you have reached the pinnacle of your profession as a botanist, being able to grow plants wherever you wish. You are no longer limited to one Awakened Tree.
Additionally, you can cast transport via plants once without expending a spell slot and you can use it to move between your Awakened Trees.
You can use this feature once, and you must finish a short or long rest to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Lightslinger
entries: A Lightslinger learns how to harness magical, radiant energy and put it to use in their weaponry. These artificers create complex machines that channel and focus light, turning that energy into powerful beams that can sear their foes. These machines come in multiple varieties, each with a distinct purpose and common name. The aurum blaster is the generalist weapon, and also the most defensive option, considering its common pairing with a shield. The bolt shooter is a long range weapon, capable of outranging longbows and taking out targets with powerful, focused blasts. The lux cannon is a short ranged weapon, capable of hitting multiple foes at once.

Though lightslingers were relatively uncommon in the time of the Old War, those that did exist made versatile combatants that were an asset to any army. Capable both as front-line soldiers and back-line artillery, these artificers are well respected warriors.

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item glassblower's tools|PHB}. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of {@item artisan's tools|PHB} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Lightslinger Spells
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Lightslinger Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Lightsmith
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, whenever you finish a short or long rest, you can magically construct one of the following weapons: an aurum blaster, a lux cannon, or a bolt shooter. If you already have a weapon constructed, you must transform that weapon Into a new type rather than constructing a new one. After you gain this subclass, the first weapon you construct is free. If you lose your weapon, however, replacing it requires 50 gp of materials. Transforming your weapon is always free. You are proficient with these weapons, and you use your Intelligence modifier for their attack and damage rolls. They function by channeling your inner magic, and thus cannot be wielded by other creatures. Each of these weapons have the following special property:

entries.name: Recharge.
entries: This value represents the number of times an attack can be made with a weapon that has the recharge property before it needs to be recharged. A weapon can be recharged as a bonus action (even if it still has charges left), but it cannot be recharged on the same turn it is used to make an attack.
The weapons' other properties are detailed in the following table:
The lux cannon's special property is described below:

entries.name: Special.
entries: You do not make attack rolls with this weapon. Instead, your attacks with it shoot blasts of radiant energy that fill a line 5-feet wide and 10-feet long extending from you. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your Artificer spell save DC or take the damage of this weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Ammunition
entries: Also at 3rd level, you can expend spell slots to temporarily empower the shots of your Lightsmith weapons. When you recharge one of these weapons, you can expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher. Until the weapon is next recharged, it has the following enhanced effects, based on the weapon's type:

entries.name: Aurum Blaster.
entries: Attacks made with the weapon deal additional radiant damage on a hit: 1d4 for a 1st level slot, 1d6 for a 2nd level slot, 1d8 for a 3rd level slot, 1d10 for a 4th level slot, and 1d12 for a slot of 5th level or higher.

entries.name: Bolt Shooter.
entries: Attacks made with the weapon explode in a burst of light. Hit or miss, the target and each creature within 5 feet of must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your artificer spell save DC or take 2d4 radiant damage for a 1st level slot, plus 1d4 for each spell level higher than 1st.

entries.name: Lux Cannon.
entries: The area of effect of attacks made with the weapon become cones, rather than lines, and any creature that fails its save against this weapon is pushed up to 5 feet away from you and knocked prone. The cone's size is equal to the line's length. Also, if you use a slot of 2nd level or higher, the weapon's damage is increased by 1d4 for each spell level higher than 1st.

subclassFeature.name: Augmented Armaments
entries: At 5th level, all of your weapons are improved. None of these improvements can be combined with the Extra Attack feature.

entries.name: Aurum Blaster.
entries: You can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn and only attack with your aurum blaster.

entries.name: Bolt Shooter.
entries: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can make a single attack with your bolt shooter. This attack is made with advantage, and unless this advantage is cancelled out by disadvantage, it deals an additional 1d12 radiant damage on a hit if the lower of the two rolls would also hit the target.

entries.name: Lux Cannon.
entries: The lines created by this weapon have a length of 20 feet, rather than 10 feet, and a creature that succeeds on the save imposed by this weapon takes half damage, rather than none.

subclassFeature.name: Aurum Bombs
entries: At 9th level, you learn how to craft magical explosives, called aurum bombs, that create bursts of blinding light. Whenever you finish a long rest, you can create a number of aurum bombs equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum 1).
Unused bombs disappear when you take your next long rest.

As an action, you can throw an aurum bomb at a point you can see within 60 feet of you. The bomb explodes at that point, forcing each creature within a 10-foot radius area to make Dexterity saving throws against your Artificer spell save DC. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d10 radiant damage and is blinded until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not blinded.

subclassFeature.name: Radiant Mastery
entries: Starting at 15th level, your Aurum Bombs and Lightsmith Weapons are both improved.

items: The damage of your aurum bombs is increased to 4d10.
Each of your Lightsmith Weapons have an additional damage die, for a total of 2d8 for the Aurum Blaster and Lux Cannon and 2d12 for the Bolt Shooter.
Whenever you use your Empowered Ammunition feature, you can transform your Lightsmith weapon into another type immediately before recharging it.

subclassFeature.name: Soulstitcher
entries: Armies need soldiers, and when a greet need arises, a macabre solution comes to light. Soulstitchers take corpses and give them new purpose in their army of undead. Specializing in the science of anatomy and necromantic magic, these artificers prefer flesh to metal as raw material.

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: When you adopt this specialization at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item leatherworker's tools|PHB} or {@item weaver's tools|PHB}. If you already have these proficiencies, you gain proficiency with one other type of {@item artisan's tools|PHB} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Soulstitcher Spells
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Soulstitcher Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare.

subclassFeature.name: Stitch Undead
entries: By 3rd level, you have mastered the art of forging an undead servant. Using your leatherworker's tools or weaver's tools, you can take an action to transform a corpse within 5 feet of you into an undead of your choice with a CR equal to 1/4th your level (rounded down). Your servant is friendly to you and your companions, and it obeys your commands. It gains temporary hit points equal to twice your artificer level.

In combat, your undead servant shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the Dodge action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you are incapacitated, the defender can take any action of its choice, not just Dodge.

If your undead servant has died within the last hour and you are within 5 feet of it, you can use your leatherworker's tools or weaver's tools as an action to revive it, by expending a spell slot of a level equal to its CR or higher (minimum of 1st-level). Your undead servant returns to life at the start of your next turn with all its hit points restored.

Once you create an undead servant, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest or until you expend a spell slot of a level equal to its CR or higher. If you already have an undead servant from this feature, the first one immediately becomes hostile to you.

subclassFeature.name: Necrotic Savant
entries: At 5th level, you develop a mastery in corrupting a creature's life force. Whenever you cast a spell using your leatherworker's tools or weaver's tools as the spellcasting focus, you can add an additional 1d4 + your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) necrotic damage to one of the spell's damage rolls.
Additionally, your undead servant's attacks now count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

subclassFeature.name: Explosive Undead
entries: Starting at 9th level, you forge an explosive failsafe into your undead servant:

As an action, you can force your undead servant to explode if you are within 60 feet of it. Doing so destroys the undead servant and forces each creature within 20 feet of it to make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking 3d8 necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

subclassFeature.name: Necrotic Mastery
entries: By 15th level, you have spent so much time dealing with undead and the forces that animate them that they pose little danger to you, and you can channel to vitality of a fallen foe into your undead servants:

items: You have resistance to necrotic damage, and your hit point maximum can't be reduced.

When an enemy you can see dies within 60 feet of you, you can use your reaction to give your undead servant, if it is within 60 feet of you, temporary hit points equal to the enemy's number of Hit Dice. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: College of Ancients
entries: Bards of the College of Ancients have deep knowledge in the area of nature magic, and they often wander the wilderness, collecting knowledge on the music of the earth. They are most often wandering singers and skalds, traveling through ancient forests, to learn how nature weaves the sounds of its flora and fauna into a beautiful rhythm.
They wish, first and foremost, to protect and honor nature. They sing tales of great floods and good harvests and oftentimes perform a symphony of bird calls. They learn to be one with nature.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you join the College of the Ancients at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item herbalism kit|PHB}, {@item shield|PHB} and you learn {@language druidic|PHB}. Bards of this college will not wear armor or use shields made of metal.

subclassFeature.name: Rootcaller
entries: Also at 3rd level, you learn how to command plants to sprout up and grasp at the heels of your foes, impeding their movement.

When a creature that you can see within 60 feet of you begins moving, you can use your reaction to expend one of your uses of Bardic Inspiration, rolling a Bardic Inspiration die and reducing the creature's speed by a number of feet equal to five times the number rolled until the end of their turn. This effect cannot reduce a creature's speed below 5 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Tongue of the Forest
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can cast {@spell speak with animals|PHB} at will.

Additionally, you gain the ability to mimic the sounds of natural fauna. To properly imitate the sounds of wildlife, you have to spend at least 1 hour in the area of which you want to mimic the voices of.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can attempt to enthrall a creature by throwing your voice to a location and creating the noise of a wild animal. Choose a point of origin within 60 feet of you. Creatures of your choice in a 15-foot-sphere centered on that point must make a Wisdom (Insight) check contested by your Charisma (Performance) check. On a failure the target is charmed by you. If a creature is immune to being charmed it automatically succeeds. When a creature is charmed in this way, it is compelled to use all of its movement to go towards the source of the sound on its next turn, after which it acts normally.

subclassFeature.name: Mysteries of Nature
entries: At 14th level, you have gained insight into the deep power of nature's magic. You learn two spells of 5th level or lower from the {@filter druid spell list|spells|class=Druid|level=5} and can cast them using this feature. You may cast each of these spells once with this feature without expending a spell slot and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.
You can exchange your spells gained from this feature with others from the druid spell list when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: College of Desire
entries: Bards of the College of Desire are peerless in a particular art, and that art is infatuation. With a pluck of a string, they can cause the heart to stir and bubble with complex emotion, whether through music or with their enchanted arrows. While a benevolent member of the College of Desire would seek to lighten the load of a heavy heart if only for a moment, many of them take advantage of their ability to cause chaos. Nothing is easier to control than the heart, or so they say.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: When you join the College of Desire at 3rd level, you gain proficiency with {@item heavy crossbow|PHB}, {@item longbow|PHB}, and the {@item lyre|PHB}.
Additionally, you can use a bow or crossbow as a spellcasting focus for your bard spells.

subclassFeature.name: Cherubic Arrow
entries: At 3rd level, you bolster a heart from a distance. While you're wielding a bow or crossbow, you can use a bonus action and expend one use of your Bardic Inspiration to choose a creature you can see other than yourself within range of your weapon. You shoot a harmless magical arrow at the creature, and it gains temporary hit points equal to the number you roll on the Bardic Inspiration die + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). If you shot a friendly creature, the next spell you cast before the end of the turn can ignore range if it doesn't have a range of self and targets only that creature.

subclassFeature.name: Cyclamen Haze
entries: At 6th level, your enemies often forget they're your enemies. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a ranged weapon attack using a bow or crossbow, you can attempt to charm it. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be charmed by you until the end of your next turn. If the creature you hit isn't hostile to you, you can instead cause the attack to deal no damage and for the arrow to vanish on contact. If you do so, the creature must instead make a Wisdom saving throw with disadvantage against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature forgets that it was shot, is charmed by you for 1 hour or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it, and can't be charmed in this way again for 24 hours. While a creature is charmed by this feature, it is also charmed by any creature that has temporary hit points from your Cherubic Arrow.

subclassFeature.name: Amorous Atmosphere
entries: At 14th level, each and every heart flutters at your presence. As an action, you can exude an aura of adoration within 30 feet of you. For 1 minute, when a creature enters the aura for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you until the start of its next turn. While a creature is charmed by this feature, it is also charmed by any creature that has temporary hit points from your Cherubic Arrow.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
